intro: Odontostemma setiferum, commonly known as the hairy odontostemma, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
